forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Cloudy. Low around 50, with temperatures rising to around 52 overnight. South southeast wind around 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South wind around 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The early hours of this wintry morning in Downtown San Francisco are cloaked in clouds, with a gentle shroud of moisture that hints at a lingering chance of rain. The air is cool, inviting a light jacket, as temperatures hover near a crisp 50 degrees. The south-southeast winds maintain a delicate whisper, stirring the chilly ambiance. While the city awakens to the dim glow of streetlights struggling against the haze, the atmosphere remains rich with the scent of impending rain, evoking a sense of both mystery and serenity.

As the day unfolds, expect a similarly cool embrace, with high temperatures barely nudging toward 59 before settling back to 56. Though the likelihood of rain lingers in the air at 40%, it offers more of a teasing presence than an outright promise. For those who venture out, a light raincoat or an umbrella could provide comfort against any unexpected droplets. Embrace the cozy ambiance by indulging in a warm drink at a local café, perhaps finding solace in a quiet corner with a good book as the rhythmic patter of rain becomes a soothing backdrop to the day. Alternatively, a leisurely stroll through one of the city's many parks could reveal the beauty of wintering landscapes under a veil of gray, where the whispers of nature and city life blur beautifully together.
